page.title: 12TECHNOLOGY IN 1985
page.content: On January 10th 1985 at Alexandra Palace the C5 was launched. The Sinclair C5 is an electric tricycle with a range of about 20 miles. When the battery runs down after the 20 miles you recharge it overnight on the mains. That costs around 5p. It isn't completely electrical_it does have pedals to maximise the range. You could call it a mix between a bicycle and an open top car but it's nothing like it. It is 1744mm long, 744mm wide and 795mm high. It weighs 30kg without battery, has a luggage capacity of 28.3l, maximum electric drive speed of 24km/ph and pneumatic tyres. The steering bars are underneath your thighs and all the controls fall to hand. On the bars you have a power button and brake levers.
